comments:
This course is an analysis of processes used in the chemical and pharmaceutical
industries. Emphasis is placed on mass and energy balances, properties of pure fluids,
and equations of state. It also focuses on heat effects accompanying phase changes and
chemical reactions.
Many students indicated that the course helped them develop necessary skills and
knowledge to be a chemical engineer. Students agreed that the course was difficult and
the problem sets for this course were unevenly lengthy, but they found them helpful in
understanding the course material and rewarding in preparing for the exams. However,
one student thought this course did “not contain that much information and could
possibly be changed to include more topics.”
Students described Professor Shieh as “flexible and reasonable about adjusting the
due dates as necessary.” One student reported that he “especially enjoyed all the real
world application Professor Shieh would discuss” in lectures. Yet, another student
thought that Dr. Shieh “did a poor job estimating how difficult the exams would be.”
Students deemed the exams as relatively difficult but fair, since each exam is 2
hours long and open-note/open-book. These exams were “a fair reflection of what was
taught in class” and were “graded exceptionally fairly.”
